content.p: Administration of Criminal Justice: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Code of criminal procedure and criminal procedure generally.
Controlled dangerous substance law and procedure.
Penal and correctional institutions and juvenile and adult rehabilitation.
Gambling, gaming, and wagering, with the exception of pari-mutuel wagering.

Agriculture, Forestry, Aquaculture, and Rural Development: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Animal industry and diseases of animals.
Production, promotion, harvesting, and marketing of forestry products.
Inspection of livestock and meat products.
Appropriations: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Deposit and investment of public monies, including the creation or modification of any special fund in the state treasury to which proceeds from state taxes, fees, or other charges are dedicated.
Study of economy and efficiency in the operation of government at all levels.
Comprehensive state capital budget, after initial consideration by the Committee on Ways and Means in accordance with House Rule 6.8(C).
Public procurement as provided in Chapter 17 of Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950.

Civil Law and Procedure: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:

Matters encompassed by the Civil Code and Civil Code Ancillaries, including, without limitation, matters affecting persons generally, marriage, divorce and matters of family law, tutorship and curatorship, things generally, use and usufruct, servitudes, successions, donations, obligations generally, extinction of obligations, delicts and quasidelicts, matrimonial agreements, sales and leases, and prescription.
Code of Civil Procedure, and civil procedure generally.
Proposed amendments to the state constitution, after initial consideration in committee of subject matter, if different from Civil Law and Procedure.
Commerce: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Communication by telephone, telegraph, radio and television.
Registering and licensing of vessels and small boats.
Regulation of common carriers by water.
Regulation, licensing, or certification of occupations and professions generally, except those fields which are health related.
Savings and loan and homestead associations.
Regulation and licensing of businesses and occupations.
Protection of trade and commerce against unlawful restraints and monopolies.
Education: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
School employees, administrators, teachers, bus drivers and others.
School employees' and teachers' pay, except where an appropriation of state funds is required.
Employees of colleges and universities, including pay, except where an appropriation of state funds is required.
Employees of vocational technical education schools, including pay, except, where an appropriation of state funds is required.
College or university agricultural extension service.

Health and Welfare: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Institutions and services for persons with intellectual disabilities.
Vocational rehabilitation including vocational rehabilitation homes.
Private and local institutions of public welfare.
Research training and rehabilitation in the field of public welfare.
Regulation, licensing, or certification of health-related occupations and professions.

House and Governmental Affairs: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Expenditures of funds by the Legislature.
Services of or for the House and/or its committees and members.
Assignment of space in state buildings, including space for legislative needs.
Rules or laws enacted to reorganize the Legislature or executive branches of government.
Intergovernmental relations between the state and the United States or other states.
The capitol building and all other buildings for general services at the state capital, including capitol parking.
Maintenance and care of capitol complex buildings.
Elections, state political parties and their committees.
Registrars of voters and their records.
Apportionment of elected officials and governing bodies.
Proposals for interim study by a committee, after initial consideration in committee of subject matter, if different from House and Governmental Affairs.
Insurance: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Compulsory motor vehicle liability security matters, motor vehicle insurance, and automobile insurance.
Judiciary: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:

All matters relating to the Supreme Court, Courts of Appeal, District Courts, Family Courts, and Juvenile Courts, matters of the jurisdiction of said courts, matters relating to judges generally, including compensation, expenses, personnel, facilities and the like, except as pertains to retirement.
All matters relating to Municipal and Parish Courts, Mayor's Courts and Justice of the Peace Courts.
All matters relating to the Attorney General, District Attorneys and prosecutors in general, including compensation, expenses, personnel, facilities and the like.
Law enforcement generally, including matters relating to public safety.
Sheriffs generally except matters affecting the sheriffs as ex officio tax collectors.
Clerks of court and records of the Courts.
National guard, Code of Military Justice and the Adjutant General.
State and local government boundary lines.
Regulations and sale of intoxicating liquors.
Miscellaneous matters not covered by other standing committees.

Labor and Industrial Relations: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:

Municipal, Parochial and Cultural Affairs: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Municipal drainage, and sewerage and water districts.
Assistance to municipal and local governments.
Revenue of and taxation levied by local governments.
Preservation of historic landmarks and objects.

Natural Resources and Environment: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Pollution of air, water, and land and environmental control generally.
Mineral resources of the public lands.
Accretion, alluvion, and dereliction of public and private lands.
Owners of minerals and mineral lands.
Materials or substances which travel through pipelines.

Retirement: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to retirement of all state officials, whether elected or appointed, of state employees, of teachers and school employees and of judges.

Transportation, Highways and Public Works: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials, and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Transportation, Highways and Public Works in general.
Rules and regulations for highway, railroad, and air use.
Pipelines, except the substances or materials which travel through the pipelines.
Flood and drainage projects, including levee districts and multiparish drainage projects.
Construction, improvement, and maintenance of waterways, lakes, and streams.
Facilities in connection with lakes, waterways, and streams.
Advertisement and letting of public contracts to the lowest responsible bidder relative to the Public Bid Law as provided in R.S. 38:2212.
Ways and Means: To this committee shall be referred, in accordance with the rules, all legislative instruments, messages, petitions, memorials and other matters relating to the following subjects:
Taxes and the raising of revenue.
Bonds and the bonding of revenue.
Issuance, payment or retirement of bonds.
Assessors, their offices, salaries, expenses, compensation, and the like.
Parish tax collectors, their offices, salaries, experiences, compensation and the like.

Comprehensive state capital budget, prior to consideration by the Committee on Appropriations in accordance with House Rule 6.8(C). HR 3, 1973; HR 3, 1975; HR 5, 1975; HR 14, 1977; HR 4, 1978; HR 4, 1979; HR 18, 1979; HR 4, 1980; HR 8, 1982; HR 10, 1983; HR 4, 2nd Ex. Sess., 1983; HR 8, 1984; HR 4, 1st Ex. Sess., 1984; HR 3, 1985; HR 11, 1991, eff. Jan. 13, 1992; HR 2, 1992 Org. Sess.; HR 27, 1993; HR 1, 1996 Org. Sess.; HR 22, 1997, eff. April 29, 1997; HR 3, 1999; HR 25, 2001; HR 13, 2003; HR 1, 2008 Org. Sess., eff. Jan. 15, 2008; HR 3, 2014, eff. June 2, 2014; HR 1, 1 st Ex. Sess., 2017. NOTE: Former House Rules 6.6(C)
merged due to the merger of Chapter 16 of Title 39 of the La. Revised Statutes of 1950 into Chapter 17 of Title 39 of the La. Revised Statutes of 1950. See
